criteria: Accuracy of Addition and Subtraction within 20
Recall of Sums of Two One-Digit Numbers
descriptions: Student is unable to perform addition or subtraction within 20.
Student demonstrates limited ability to add and subtract within 20, with frequent errors.
Student can add and subtract within 20 with some accuracy, but makes occasional errors and hesitates.
Student accurately adds and subtracts within 20 using mental strategies most of the time, with few errors.
Student consistently and accurately adds and subtracts within 20 using mental strategies, demonstrating fluency.
Student demonstrates mastery of addition and subtraction within 20, fluently and accurately applying mental strategies, and can explain their reasoning.
Student does not use mental strategies or attempts inefficient methods.
Student attempts to use mental strategies but struggles and relies heavily on counting or other inefficient methods.
Student uses mental strategies inconsistently, sometimes reverting to less efficient methods.
Student generally uses appropriate mental strategies for addition and subtraction within 20.
Student effectively and consistently uses a variety of mental strategies to solve addition and subtraction problems within 20.
Student skillfully and flexibly applies a variety of mental strategies, adapting their approach based on the problem, and can articulate why they chose a particular strategy.
Student does not know from memory any sums of two one-digit numbers.
Student knows very few sums of two one-digit numbers and relies heavily on calculation.
Student knows some sums of two one-digit numbers but hesitates or makes errors.
Student knows most sums of two one-digit numbers and can recall them with reasonable accuracy.
Student knows from memory nearly all sums of two one-digit numbers and can recall them quickly and accurately.
Student demonstrates automaticity with sums of two one-digit numbers, recalling them instantly and accurately, and using this knowledge to solve more complex problems.
